Summary: SPAIN: With firefighters continuing to battle 14 major blazes across Spain, home and business owners are being advised of precautions to take with their air conditioning systems.

Title: Fourth person dies in New York LD outbreak
Summary: USA: A fourth person is reported to have died from the outbreak of legionnaires’ disease in New York City's Harlem neighbourhood.

Title: GE pledges $3bn US investment
Summary: USA: GE Appliances has revealed that it will invest more than $3bn over the next five years in its US operations.

Title: Samsung approves Chemours immersion cooling fluid
Summary: USA: Chemours has revealed that its Opteon two-phase immersion cooling fluid has been qualified by Samsung Electronics, following testing by the Korean computer manufacturer.

Title: Triton sells Kelvion to Apollo funds
Summary: GERMANY: US asset management firm Apollo is to acquire a majority stake in German heat exchanger products manufacturer Kelvion.

Title: Trane Technologies launches BrainBox AI Lab
Summary: IRELAND: Trane Technologies has announced the launch of the BrainBox AI Lab to serve as a hub for research into furthering intelligent, efficient and sustainable building operations.

Title: Stallion plans R32 plant in Rajasthan
Summary: INDIA: Stallion India Fluorochemicals, a Mumbai-based supplier of refrigerants, is to build a $13.7m R32 plant in the Bhilwara district of Rajasthan.

Title: Kelvion expands to meet data centre demand
Summary: GERMANY: Kelvion has announced the addition of 55,000m² of new production space at its factories in Tulsa, Oklahoma and Opole, Poland, to support demand for data centre cooling solutions.

Title: Daikin heat pumps for Ukrainian schools
Summary: BELGIUM: Daikin Europe has supplied heat pump systems, air conditioners, and air purifiers to schools in Ukraine to help rebuild critical public infrastructure damaged by the war.

Title: Aira announces further €150m investment
Summary: SWEDEN: Swedish heat pump company Aira has announced a further €150m of equity financing expand its European to operations and launch new innovations.

Title: Bluu Unit expands German footprint
Summary: GERMANY: Bluu Unit, a group of refrigeration, air conditioning and ventilation firms, has bolstered its German footprint by acquiring Düsseldorf-based ACI Group and Heuberger Kälte Klima GmbH from Bayreuth.

Title: Nepal ratifies the Kigali Amendment
Summary: NEPAL: The Federal Democratic Republic of Nepal is the first country in 2025 to ratify the Kigali Amendment.

Title: Danfoss discusses refrigerant options
Summary: DENMARK: Danfoss has produced a new whitepaper examining the trends and drivers in selecting refrigerants for HVACR systems.

Title: Illegal R134a found on bus in Serbia
Summary: SERBIA: A further attempt to smuggle small quantities of refrigerant across borders by bus has been uncovered, this time by authorities in Serbia.

Title: Daikin sales down 3% in Q1
Summary: JAPAN: Daikin has reported Q1 net sales of JPY1,213,821m ($8.2bn), down 3% on the April-June period in 2024, but operating profit was up 5.1% at JPY121,300m ($822m).

Title: Panasonic claims first hydrogen/gas-fired absorption chiller
Summary: JAPAN: A consortium of Japanese companies has developed what is claimed to be the industry's first absorption chiller-heater compatible with mixed combustion of hydrogen and natural gas.

Title: Company agrees $16m penalty for failing to report faulty AC units
Summary: USA: A company which sold dangerous portable air conditioners has agreed a civil penalty and restitution totalling over $16.4m.

Title: Barcelona metro trials fabric duct cooling system
Summary: SPAIN: A new cooling system using fabric diffusers manufactured by Danish company FabricAir is being trialled on the Barcelona metro.

Title: Infected cooling towers found in New York LD outbreak
Summary: USA: Legionella pneumophila has been found in cooling towers in the Central Harlem district of New York following investigations into a legionnaires’ disease outbreak that has killed two people.

Title: Daikin Applied to acquire US data centre cooling firm
Summary: USA: Daikin Applied has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire DDC Solutions, a San Diego-based developer of ultra-high-density cooling cabinets and management software for data centres.

Title: Carel Q2 sales increase to €158.8m
Summary: ITALY: Controls company Carel has reported a Q2 sales increase of 9.4% to €158.8m, compared to 2024, equivalent to an 11.3% rise at constant exchange rates.

Title: Carrier acquires German building controls business
Summary: GERMANY: Carrier has acquired Blaich Automation GmbH, a German provider of integrated automation solutions for buildings, industrial systems and media technologies, as an Automated Logic field office.

Title: Control Solutions expands ALC network
Summary: CANADA: Carrier subsidiary Automated Logic – Canada (ALC), a leading provider of building management solutions, has acquired Control Solutions, an independent provider of integrated building automation systems.

Title: Middleby acquires Frigomeccanica SpA
Summary: USA/ITALY: The Middleby Corporation, a leading worldwide manufacturer of commercial and residential foodservice and food processing equipment, has acquired Frigomeccanica SpA.

Title: JCI embarks on “next era”
Summary: IRELAND: Johnson Controls says it has positioned itself as a leading pure-play provider of building solutions following the sale of its residential and light commercial HVAC business to Bosch.

Title: Hitachi sees global expansion after JV sale
Summary: JAPAN: Hitachi has confirmed the acquisition of the commercial air conditioning factory which had been owned under its former joint venture business with Johnson Controls.

Title: Bosch completes JCI Hitachi JV purchase
Summary: GERMANY: Bosch has announced the successful completion of the €7.4m purchase of the Johnson Controls residential and light commercial HVAC business and the Johnson Controls-Hitachi…

Title: AHRI to begin lower-GWP refrigerant research
Summary: USA: The Air-Conditioning, Heating and Refrigeration Institute (AHRI) has announced an industry-wide cooperative research programme to identify and evaluate promising alternative refrigerants with a GWP under 300.

Title: ASHRAE/UNEP launch sustainability assessment tools
Summary: USA: ASHRAE and the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) OzonAction have released new checklists and guidance sheets to support RAC equipment performance, compliance and sustainability.

Title: Carrier sales up 3% in Q2
Summary: USA: Carrier has reported strong financial results for Q2 of 2025, with net sales up 3% at $6,113m and organic sales up 6%.

Title: Lu-Ve begins shipping dry coolers from Chinese factory
Summary: ITALY/CHINA: Italian heat exchanger and cooling system manufacturer Lu-Ve has begun delivery of Giants dry coolers from its Chinese production facility.

Title: Nidec plans new Embraco compressor factory in India
Summary: JAPAN/INDIA: Nidec has announced a 55,000m2 factory in India for the production of its Embraco-brand residential and commercial refrigeration compressors.

Title: Trane opens commercial hub in Idaho
Summary: USA: Trane has officially opened a 26,000ft2 (2,415m2) sales office in Nampa to serve as a local hub for its commercial operations in Idaho.

Title: Bulgarian customs seize more refrigerant
Summary: BULGARIA: Authorities have seized a further 3 tonnes of undeclared refrigerant being carried in the luggage compartment of a minibus in Svilengrad, Haskovo province.

Title: HVAC business offsets LG Q2 performance
Summary: SOUTH KOREA: Increased sales in its HVAC segment helped offset a dip in LG Electronics group’s performance in Q2.

Title: Bus used in refrigerant smuggling attempt
Summary: BULGARIA: Authorities in Bulgaria have detained four people for attempting to smuggle nearly six tonnes of refrigerant and other goods in a bus.

Title: Cuthbertson to be president Systemair North America
Summary: USA: Swedish HVAC equipment manufacturer Systemair has appointed Steve Cuthbertson as president of Systemair North America, effective September 8.

Title: Panasonic uses fridge camera to reduce waste
Summary: JAPAN: Panasonic is involved in an experiment to reduce household food waste through the use of refrigerator AI cameras.

Title: £250 promo on Panasonic Mini VRF
Summary: UK: Panasonic Heating and Cooling Solutions has introduced a new installer incentive to promote its ECOi Mini VRF outdoor units.

Title: Wolseley revamps Climate Centre branches
Summary: UK: Pipe Centre and Climate Centre says it has made a significant investment in five key UK branches in the last few months.

Title: BESA backs cooling for UK buildings
Summary: UK: The Building Engineering Services Association (BESA) is calling for urgent action to tackle overheating in buildings, as the UK experiences rising temperatures and heat-related deaths.

Title: Network Rail trials passive cooling system
Summary: UK: A new passive cooling system, currently being deployed in railway signalling cabinets to combat excessive heat, could improve the efficiency of commercial refrigeration cabinets.

Title: Williams’ employees celebrate 190 years
Summary: UK: Long-service awards have been made to eight employees who have given 190 years of service at Williams Refrigeration.

Title: Prizes for outstanding Adaptation papers
Summary: UK: Institute of Refrigeration president, Lisa-Jayne Cook, has presented certificates and prizes for three research papers presented by students at this week’s Adaptation 2025 conference in Manchester.

Title: Lib Dems call to heatproof the NHS
Summary: UK: With an increasing number of heat related deaths amongst older people, the Liberal Democrat party has called on the UK government to ensure all care homes are air conditioned.

Title: Apleona acquires Hampshire FM company Corrigenda
Summary: UK: Germany-based European integrated facilities management company Apleona has acquired Hampshire-based technical facility management company Corrigenda.

Title: Aira heat pump advert was “misleading”
Summary: UK: A social media advert by the UK subsidiary of Swedish heat pump manufacturer has been considered misleading and banned by the Advertising Standards Authority (ASA).

Title: J&E Hall restructures sales team
Summary: UK: Changes to the regional sales structure at J&E Hall’s commercial refrigeration business sees senior manager Tony Twine ceding his UK-wide responsibilities to national sales manager Paul McDermott.

Title: Government to consult on late payments
Summary: UK: The building services sector has welcomed the government’s announcement of a consultation on late, long and disputed business to business payments.

Title: Chancellor Reeves visits Kensa heat pumps
Summary: UK: The chancellor of the exchequer, Rachel Reeves, visited Truro-based ground-source heat pump manufacturer Kensa, today, on a trip to hear from Cornish businesses driving green growth.

Title: Steve Gill to stand again for IOR president
Summary: UK: Former Institute of Refrigeration president Steve Gill is to stand again for the role having been named as one of three nominations for the position of president-elect.

Title: BSRIA extends performance testing capability
Summary: UK: BSRIA has extended its UKAS-accredited testing capabilities to include the EN 14825:2022 standard following a comprehensive ISO 17025 audit by the UK’s National Accreditation Service.

Title: Daikin merchant opens 4th Sustainable Home Centre
Summary: UK: Daikin has opened a further Sustainable Home Centre, its fourth in partnership with independent plumbers’ merchant James Hargreaves.

Title: BESA calls for BUS upgrade to include cooling
Summary: UK: The Building Engineering Services Association (BESA) has called for a revision of the Boiler Upgrade Scheme to include incentives for heat pumps which provide both heating and cooling.

Title: Taylor-Hamlin named as HPA vice chair
Summary: UK: Daikin UK’s senior environment research manager, Chris Taylor-Hamlin, has been named as the Heat Pump Association’s next vice chair. He will officially take up the post in September.

Title: Paul Moseley 1963-2025
Summary: UK: Fareham-based Coolers and Condensers has announced the death of its long-serving technical director Paul Moseley. He was 61.

Title: Wolseley leases NE distribution centre
Summary: UK: Wholesaler Wolseley has taken a lease on a new 107,775ft2 distribution centre in Darlington.

Title: AI-powered wall-mount air conditioner
Summary: GERMANY: Midea Europe GmbH is launching Solstice, a new wall-mounted air conditioner that combines energy-efficiency with artificial intelligence.

Title: Daikin AHU meets healthcare demands
Summary: UK: Daikin Applied (UK) has unveiled the HTM-Pro T Series, a compact air handling unit designed to meet the stringent NHS HTM 03-01 ventilation guidelines for healthcare environments.

Title: Copeland scrolls for heat pump applications
Summary: USA: Copeland has announced two new variable-speed scroll compressor series for a wide range of commercial and residential heat pump applications.

Title: Haier wall-mounts track energy consumption
Summary: ITALY: Haier has announced the launch of its new Serene series of wall-mounted indoor air conditioning units with embedded energy management.

Title: Carrier VRF on R454B
Summary: USA: Carrier has released Opti-V, a next-generation VRF heat pump system running on R454B for the US market.

Title: HC heat pumps to 170°C flow temperatures
Summary: UK: Danish manufacturer Solid Energy has upgraded its range of hydrocarbon-based ultra-high temperature heat pumps with a new line-up capable of reaching flow temperatures of…

Title: Atlas Copco upgrades industrial chillers
Summary: UK: Atlas Copco has launched an upgrade of its TCX series of industrial chillers to provide an expanded capacity range using R32 refrigerant.

Title: Sanhua solenoid valve expands R744 range
Summary: SPAIN: The CDF-U solenoid valve expands Sanhua’s R744 product range to meet the growing demand for efficient and sustainable CO₂ refrigeration solutions.

Title: Clivet low-profile ductable fan coils
Summary: ITALY: Larice is the name of the new range of ductable fan coil units from Clivet.

Title: Total People opens in Wythenshawe
Summary: UK: Apprenticeship provider Total People has opened a new training facility in Wythenshawe to support engineering skills growth in Greater Manchester and Cheshire.

Title: Daikin UK unveils nationwide events programme
Summary: UK: Daikin UK is to embark on a nationwide series of regional events for commercial heating and cooling installers and consultants.

Title: Carrier launches training for transport fridge engineers
Summary: UK: Carrier Transicold has introduced a dedicated training programme that offers formal accreditation for engineers working on its fully electric product line.

Title: Innovation Meets Real-World Impact in Season 5 of Trane Technologies’ Healthy Spaces Podcast
Summary: SWORDS, Ireland--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Trane Technologies (NYSE:TT), a global climate innovator, announces the launch of Season 5 of Healthy Spaces, a climate technology podcast that explores the innovations transforming buildings and transport systems into more sustainable solutions.

Title: Forbes Recognizes Trane Technologies as One of America’s Best Employers for Women in 2025
Summary: SWORDS, Ireland--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Trane Technologies (NYSE:TT), a global climate innovator, has been named to Forbes’ list of America’s Best Employers for Women 2025. Compiled in collaboration with market research company Statista, this prestigious ranking recognizes Trane Technologies’ efforts to create a workplace where all employees can thrive, lead, and are empowered to succeed.

Title: Trane Technologies Launches BrainBox AI Lab to Transform Energy Management and Sustainability in Buildings
Summary: SWORDS, Ireland--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Trane Technologies (NYSE:TT), a global climate innovator, today announced the launch of the BrainBox AI Lab – igniting a new era in energy optimization for heating, ventilation, and air conditioning (HVAC) solutions in the built environment and refrigerated transport.

Title: Trane Technologies Reports Strong Second Quarter Results; Raises Full-Year Revenue and EPS Guidance
Summary: SWORDS, Ireland--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Trane Technologies plc (NYSE:TT), a global climate innovator, today reported diluted earnings per share (EPS) from continuing operations of $3.87 for the second quarter of 2025. Adjusted continuing EPS was $3.88, up 18 percent.

Title: H1 2025: Robust results despite volatile environment
Summary: Throughout the first half of the year, inventory corrections in our markets have progressed. Order intake and sales continuously improved over the same period with slightly positive sales growth in the second quarter. The operational EBITA margin continued to improve in the first half and reached 11.5% in the second quarter, in line with expectations.

Title: Danfoss SLP13-10 cartridge valve enhances hydraulic efficiency and productivity
Summary: With its low electric power consumption, the SLP13-10 valve helps improve efficiency, reduce operational costs, and enhance system performance.

Title: Danfoss nozzle spray technology elevates automotive paint quality
Summary: Danfoss Spray Technology Boosts Automotive Paint Quality

Title: Danfoss Power Solutions completes UQDB coupling portfolio, offering high efficiency and reliability in data center liquid cooling applications
Summary: Offering direct connection between servers and manifolds in data center liquid cooling applications, Danfoss' UQDB coupling is Open Compute Project compliant. The complete portfolio now includes -02, -04, -06, and -08 sizes.

Title: New Airflex Failsafe Caliper Brake from Danfoss maximizes safety, durability, and serviceability in demanding applications
Summary: The Airflex ACB-F3 Failsafe Caliper Brake is a spring-applied, hydraulically released brake. A new solution for park-and-hold or emergency stop applications, the Airflex ACB-F3 is ideal for the oil and gas, mining, marine, processing, and metals industries.

Title: Danfoss introduces Thorx CLM 5 C cam lobe motor, a breakthrough in efficiency and performance for road rollers
Summary: The CLM 5 C motor features a robust, novel design that eliminates leakage, enables smoother road finishing, reduces service issues, and extends component lifetime.

Title: LG to Introduce Advanced AI Home Innovations at IFA 2025
Summary: , 2025 — LG Electronics (LG) is inviting consumers from around the globe to Berlin, Germany, to experience its latest AI appliance innovations at IFA 2025, taking place from September 5 to 9. Under the theme of “LG AI Appliances Orchestra,” the company will present its AI Home Solution – a harmonious integration of AI-powered appliances designed to enrich and enhance the European lifestyle.

Title: LG Releases Second-Quarter 2025 Financial Results
Summary: — LG Electronics Inc. (LG) today announced consolidated revenue of KRW 20.74 trillion and operating profit of KRW 639.4 billion for the second quarter of 2025.

Title: LG Unveils AI-Driven, Energy-Efficient Laundry Solutions at IFA 2025
Summary: Aug. 21, 2025 — LG Electronics (LG) is set to showcase a comprehensive suite of advanced AI-powered laundry solutions with maximized energy efficiency at IFA 2025. The new lineup meets a growing demand for sustainable appliances in the European market, with energy-efficient laundry products that accommodate a variety of lifestyles and living spaces.

Title: LG Presents New Space- and Energy-Efficient Refrigerator Lineup at IFA 2025
Summary: Aug. 19, 2025 — LG Electronics (LG) is unveiling its latest refrigerator lineup for the European market at IFA 2025. Designed to deliver top-tier energy efficiency, the new french door and bottom-freezer models have been developed specifically for Europe’s unique housing environments and consumer lifestyles, reflecting LG’s extensive research into local needs and preferences. The lineup combines energy-saving performance, smart features and space-efficient styling that integrates seamlessly into modern homes.

Title: LG Enhances Gaming Ecosystem With Gaming Portal Power Up, Cloud Gaming Innovation
Summary: , 2025 — LG Electronics (LG) is advancing its Gaming Portal1 as the ultimate gaming platform, offering a wide range of games and unparalleled versatility for webOS-powered TVs and devices. Now available in over 30 countries, the revamped Gaming Portal is transforming how players experience both native webOS games and AAA titles, whether accessed via remote control or a game pad.

Title: LG Channels Grows News Viewership Through Enhanced User Experience
Summary: Aug. 8, 2025 — LG Electronics (LG) is advancing LG Channels viewership growth across the world, thanks to its intuitive user interface and growing variety of content. As part of this effort, LG is partnering with leading broadcasters and news organizations across multiple regions to add more news streams to the platform, making them both relevant to local audiences and easier to access and explore.

Title: LG CineBeam S Delivers Unrivaled Viewing Immersion and Unprecedented Flexibility
Summary: — LG Electronics (LG) today announced the beginning of the global rollout of the LG CineBeam S (model PU615U), a compact yet powerful 4K Ultra Short Throw (UST) projector designed to deliver premium home entertainment and unprecedented flexibility. Building on the legacy of the LG CineBeam Q, the new model elevates viewer immersion with vibrant, large-scale images in stunning 4K (3,840 x 2,160) and cinematic audio with dynamic Dolby Atmos sound. Introducing the concept of “Wonder beyond spatial limits,” the stylish LG CineBeam S can turn even the smallest space into a premier personal theater.

Title: MMCA×LG OLED Series Kicks Off to Bring Digital Art Closer to the Public
Summary: , 2025 — LG Electronics (LG) announces “MMCA×LG OLED Series 2025 – TZUSOO,” the inaugural exhibition of a multi-year partnership with the National Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art, Korea (MMCA). This forward-looking project explores the creative possibilities at the intersection of art and technology – beginning with a large-scale digital installation by Korean media artist TZUSOO, on view at MMCA Seoul’s iconic Seoul Box from August 1, 2025, through February 1, 2026.

Title: LG Secures Top Cybersecurity Certification at Largest Vehicle Component Production Base
Summary: , Aug. 20, 2025 — LG Electronics (LG), a leading innovator in mobility technology, today announced that its Hai Phong manufacturing facility in Vietnam – the company’s largest production hub for vehicle components – has earned Cyber Security Management System (CSMS) Level 3 certification from TÜV Rheinland, a global testing and certification agency. The certification ceremony was held on August 19 (local time) at the Hai Phong plant.

Title: LG to Unveil New Content Partnerships to Enhance In-Vehicle Experience at IAA MOBILITY 2025
Summary: , Aug. 19, 2025 — LG Electronics (LG), a leading innovator in mobility technology, is set to present its forward-thinking vision for future mobility at IAA MOBILITY 2025 in Munich, Germany, this September. Recognized as the world’s leading platform for mobility, technology and sustainability, IAA MOBILITY brings together global leaders across industries. Key themes at this year’s event include the software-defined vehicle (SDV), AI, connectivity and smart infrastructure.

Title: LG Adopts Eco-Conscious Manufacturing Innovations for 4-Way System Air Conditioner
Summary: Aug. 18, 2025 — LG Electronics (LG) is reducing plastic consumption and carbon emissions by adopting a new material and manufacturing process for its commercial 4-way system air conditioners. Aligned with the company’s Better Life for All ESG vision, these latest efforts demonstrate an unwavering commitment to minimizing environmental impacts.
